references.reason: This paper is foundational in the study of implicit regularization, establishing the importance of optimization algorithms in shaping model solutions.

references.paper_title: The implicit bias of gradient descent on separable data
references.reason: This paper is highly influential for characterizing the implicit bias of gradient descent in the linearly separable classification setting, laying a theoretical groundwork for much of the current research.

references.paper_title: Characterizing the implicit bias via a primal-dual analysis
references.reason: This paper offers a refined analysis of implicit bias using primal-dual methods, providing more precise characterizations than prior work.

references.paper_title: Kernel and rich regimes in overparametrized models
references.reason: This paper explores the implicit regularization in broader settings, beyond linear models, introducing the concept of 'mirror descent' structure in gradient-based optimization.

references.paper_title: Mirror descent maximizes generalized margin and can be implemented efficiently
references.reason: This work connects mirror descent with maximum margin classifiers, providing a more unified view of implicit regularization in high-dimensional settings.
